comments.commentBody: She destroyed HP, cutting it's worth in half during her tenure, along with "right sizing" aka laying off thousands of people.  "Business Acumen" she has, if you define it as lining your own pockets, no matter what happens to the company you run.

One of the lines, I remember, was "I always knew how much I loved him but I didn't realize how much he loved me."

You just brought me to tears.

When my first, as an adult, dog died I embroidered a little plaque with a sort of poem I wrote. It seemed the purpose of the tribute was to try to heal my aching heart. After 31 years I can still get tears thinking about him.

One of the lines, I remember, was "I always knew how much I loved him but I didn't realize how much he loved me." This awareness of course occurred because I was lost suddenly without his companionship - and yes, love.

Enjoy every day of the happiness an animal can bring. Their live is pure.
Do try it !
Yes--cats are easier to care for. And some shelters offer no-fee adoption of older cats to people over a certain age.

An older cat might be just the ticket.  Our sanctuary recently adopted out a cat (had to be a black cat, I recall) to an older gentleman who had just lost his.  His family definitely wanted a cat that would outlive him, and promised that the cat would have a forever home with them after their beloved grandfather died.  It was a perfect setup for just the right, lap-loving cat, and we had just the one to fit that bill.

"sailing the bed like a rickety boat into what, if recent days are any indication, will be another pretty good day" So poetic, beautifully written, thank you.
Makes me wonder if my grandmother, an inveterate dog-lover who is too old to care for one now, could have a cat ...
The healing power of pets!!! All animals are sentient beings who are capable of receiving and giving love. I'm so thankful for animals!!!!!

I doubt any of the major world countries are interested in a face off war with each other. It will just be more of the same. See how far you take land grabs. Fight proxy wars in countries who you don't care about, or ones that already have internal conflict to begin with. The one thing that I do wonder about is a country like N Korea whose leader is somewhat unstable, albeit more of a blow hard then a antagonist. Japan and PM Abe has to wonder if this could be a threat down the road.

you should read this book. written by ian buruma about 20 years ago. I lived in japan off and on for about 35-40% of the time from april 1993-april 2012 in Osaka, sakai and, mostly, nara in the kansai area. I wouldn't trust abe as far as I could throw him.

Wages of Guilt: Memories of War in Germany and Japan

Bernie isn't damaging Democrats at all -- if anything, he'll push Clinton in a progressive direction, which needs to be done.

The only way Bernie will damage -- perhaps destroy -- the Democrats will be if he's nominated. Then he'll lead the party to a slaughter not seen since George McGovern on the left or Barry Goldwater on the right. Both of these men were fiercely, devotedly, loved by a segment of their respective parties -- a segment just large enough to get the nomination, but with policies so extreme that they had no chance of winning independents and were utterly destroyed in the election, with long-term damage to their parties. Let's hope it doesn't happen again.

I think that for hard core gun advocates, liberty trumps safety. This is the price we pay for being free.

The only argument that will possibly work has to be a monetary one that points to the cost of all these deaths and injuries and demands that gun owners need to shoulder the costs for every accidental shooting with one of their guns and for gun owners and dealers to be held accountable for every one of their guns that is involved in an illegal activity.

Let's allow health insurers to charge more for people who have guns in their homes. Life insurers do it, don't they?

Look up the definition of hyperbole. You'll see your name. Given the FACT that entitlements take up 71% of the federal budget what is your solution to the aging population and the FACT that 3 million baby booomers retire every year. What is your solution? Tax the rich? That is liberals solution to everything. That is not a plausible solution. Tell me exactly what you will do when demand outstrips revenue. Because that day is coming. Same with Medicare. What is your solution to do deal with the enormous demands that are being placed on the system. I don't see one solution, just a bunch of finger pointing. Why didn't Obama deal with this when he had both chambers and after Harry Reid invoked the nuclear option? There was nothing the Republicans could do because a simple majority would pass a bill.
You clearly do not do your research and I suggest you try doing it in the future. Before your taxes go up.

comments.userDisplayName: Al, The Plumber of the Depths of Lunacy
comments.commentBody:
Despite megatons of Democratic propaganda, the sexist, racist, ethnically biased, age biased, etc. Social "Security" financial lunacy is a massive disaster.

Of course, REAL causation and evidence don't matter, but just for starters, its own trustees and actuaries recently announced that it added another $900 BILLION in net long-term unfunded liabilities in 2014 to "attain" yet another record of $25.8 TRILLION!!! Congratulations!

Worse yet, a recent Harvard-Dartmouth study (and also other economists) say the calculations are con jobs, greatly exaggerating the number of years to the exhaustion of the reserves.

Furthermore, the Sanders, Warren, etc. "solutions" are ridiculous. People such as Prof. Laurence Kotlikoff have good stating points to fix Government's Unaccountable Accounting and various gigantic Government debacles, but of course, few care about any REAL solutions.

Republicans have a shot at fulfilling their dream since 1935: killing Social Security. I hope and expect their evil, selfish scheming will further weaken, if not kill, what remains of the Republican Party.
He would be by far the oldest president to begin his first term.  Reagan isn't in the same ballpark.

Run, Biden, run!  I am not the idealist I used to be so don't take this as more than it is but...Clinton vs. Biden?? Why is there even a question as to who is the better candidate? He is an experienced statesman, an independent thinker who votes on issues not party lines, he's funny, he's got a soul, he's smart, he cares (or seems to).  Clinton is all ego and Wall Street and is, rather transparently, all about political calculations and carefully crafted one-liners--with a terrible delivery. I sincerely hope he throws his hat into the race. Warren would be my first choice but...that's not happening. So, if Biden says he runs, I'm contributing to his campaign...along with Sanders', because the latter will take the debate where it needs to (finally) go and then Biden will get the job done.

Go Joe. Please. For the sake of America. You could outalk Trump. And do it with integrity, experience and wisdom.

Now what you need is a very young, centrist, super smart nerdy almost, economically savvy, green, VP.
Agree a personal legacy is much more important than how well our country is governed. This is the age of narcissism after all. Personal glory is key to immortality.
Yes, but he is a race horse who has heard the trumpet's call.
Absolutely. Why risk his ascendency to the parthenon of exalted VPs? That failed bid for the Presidency absolutely ruined Walter Mondale's legacy.

Dr. Biden, The VP's wife, has a very assured stance on most things in her husband's career. And why wouldn't she? Having said that, I'd be watching the doctor if you want to sleuth an answer even Joe Biden doesn't know. So the whole thing is a freak show…people talking about serious stuff based on nothing because it is A L L speculation until Joe Biden says he's in or not. Frankly, were I him, I'd go out as a celebrated VP, member of Congress with a personal tragedy that is operatic. I say, give a long deserved rest.

Biden is a heavyweight. He could deck Trump in the first round.
To dismiss him so casually is, to put it gently, unwise.
What percent of the vote did he win when he ran in '08?

Biden's chances of actually winning the nomination are even slimmer than Sanders'.  Assuming this is the case, his candidacy can only help Clinton, since Biden's supporters are more likely to support Hillary than Bernie.  Yes, alot can happen in the next few months.  But Biden's candidacy is likely to be a win for Clinton and a loss for Sanders.

Seeing Rory McIlroy's beautiful swings are always fun to watch.  To see Jordan Spieth's deft touches around the greens is another joy for television viewers (I have to wake up 3:00 a.m. in Korea to watch them to play).  I certainly wish my countryman Y.E. Yang took the second PGA championship after 2009, the new rivalry between Rory and Jordan should much boost golf viewership around the world in the years to come.  What a great time for golf after Tiger Woods' dominace during 1997~2009!
Surprised you didn't bring up the plagiarism business. You obviously haven't listened to him in a very long time.

It is not so much what he did then, as what he would do next. People learn.
As to militarism, no one gets to the White House without it!...America Must be Strong, don't you know.
did he!  wow that was a mistake. But in all other respects he has been remarkably correct.

That a man who discounted Anita HIlls testimony and was instrumental to the war on drugs could be supported blindly by democrats as a result of personal tragedy and not being Ms. Clinton is very troubling. I urge constituents to look at his record, not his personal history, nor his handsome swagger. While personality and character no doubt matter, Biden is more to the right than Clinton, just fyi.

"The harm that theology has done is not to create cruel impulses, but to give them the sanction of what professes to be lofty ethic, and to confer an apparently sacred character upon practices which have come down from more ignorant and barbarous times."
Bertrand Russell

Reading this and much other material about the state of the world, one can only conclude that humans are still in a very barbaric state of evolution and that any higher, civilized state seems almost impossibly far away !! On the face of it and in order to save these innocent girls and their communities, the immediate means seems to be the defeat of these idiotic and inestimably evil gunmen. The long-term means seems to be a reeducation of the entire human race by enlightened, rational humans, a collective and rational re-examination of  so called scripture, the elimination of drivel from them or elimination of entire scriptures which are at odds with a truly spiritual, sage  wise, and humanitarian understanding of he universe and life. These vulgar, base and despicable human beings are an embarrassment to the whole race and are not at all fit to be called humans. I know it's well nigh impossible for all of these things to take place, so we will have to let nature take its course.

List the Immans, Arab oil barons, despots, militia leaders, and other sundry Islamic organizations that are lining up to voice their outrage and then make the distinction. I love it when people prattle about the "vast majority" of muslims not buying into this 14 century barbarity. Really? Where's the evidence of that? My son's first words were Arabic; his care giver was Muslim; I am an Arabic literature scholar who speaks Arabic and has lived and worked in the Mideast. Again, show me the evidence because, brother, I am not seeing or hearing it.
I have read readers here advocate the use of atomic weapons, chemical weapons, and now castration against anyone they fear. I'm having a difficult time sorting out who is sick and who is not.
If they were castrated they'd probably capture girls and torture them.

After a fair trial, all men identified as members of the Islamic state, or financial supporters of the Islamic State, should be castrated. The world cannot risk having these monsters contaminating the gene pool. This punishment would include any pampered sons of middle-class citizens of Western Countries. No exemptions for the well-to-do.

Granted the War was unjustified. However, a greater injustice occurred when America walked away without rebuilding Iraq. The case of rebuilding Japan and Europe established peace, order and prosperity, My thanks go out to America and people like Truman, MacArthur, Marshall, Eisenhower and the American people who supported rebuilding the destroyed countries of World War II.

agreed, and the atrocities committed in the name of "I'm the leader, and there is no God, do as I say or suffer the consequences" are just as numerous and unjustified as the former. So humans are barbaric. At least we've established that.

Larry, I think the verses from the Koran are the verses from the Koran.   I agree that the overwhelming majority of Muslims do not pay attention to these verses, but unfortunate none the less than they  exist.
If there is a God, he should repent.

And God wept.
I pray for healing for these women, these children, and all the Yazidi men who have suffered these war crimes.
I pray for justice for them.
I pray for repentance for all those who perpetrate this, through action or inaction.

Exodus? Sanctions? Drones? Nuclear option? What on earth do you do with these beasts? I almost can't type I feel so much repulsion, sadness, anger.

This is nothing short of genocide and any nation that ignores it participates in it. Including every presidential candidate, every journalist, every lawmaker, me. And perhaps especially any Muslim who does not take action against this; I hold everyone who chooses that religion most accountable of all. And to every woman covering up for so-called modesty -- I have reached the point where I just don't buy it. Protect your daughters and teach them their value beyond serving men.

And finally, it's disturbing bad that Trump got more comments.

War is hell. And, we all pray that God is on our side. These atrocities happen in every theater but to institutionalize it, create a bureaucracy to support it, that is truly the work of the devil. Don't waste our multimillion dollar smart bombs and surgical strikes on them. White Phosphorous and jellied gasoline is what's called for but that means boots on the ground, again and, for this old man, anyway, that is a non-starter. I think I will go outside and scream at the Universe now, again.
